original_text:
**INSTITUTION
Discharge Summary
Name :
**NAME[AAA , BBB]
Acct # :
**ID-NUM
MRN :
**ID-NUM
Admitted :
Discharged :
**DATE[Mar 31 2007]
Dict :
**NAME[XXX , WWW]
Attend :
**NAME[ZZZ , YYY]
The patient was admitted with unstable angina .
She underwent catheterization on **DATE[Mar 30 2007] .
She was found to have normal left main .
She had a long area of 60% to 70% disease in the proximal and mid LAD .
The circumflex gave rise to two obtuse marginal arteries .
There was at least 70% disease in the proximal portion of the OM1 as well as the mid portion .
The culprit appeared to be the right coronary which is a largest dominant vessel .
He had a 99% stenosis in the mid portion also involving a long area of at least 60% to 70% mid right coronary disease .
This was stented with a 3.5 x 33 Cypher stent .
There was no residual stenosis .
LV function was normal .
She appeared to have at least 1 to 2+ mild to moderate MR .
DISCHARGE MEDICATIONS :
Same as she was admitted on .
She will need long term aspirin and Plavix .
FINAL DIAGNOSES :
1. Unstable angina .
2. Coronary artery disease .
3. Hypertension .
4. Hyperlipidemia .
______________________________
**NAME[WWW M XXX] , MD
HS Job # 147857 / 37776 / 31461
SHY # **ID-NUM
D :
**DATE[Mar 30 2007] 07:58
T :
**DATE[Mar 31 2007] 13:19
**CARBON-COPY
